content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at position(5.0, 5.0)
Consists of a single furnace entity used to smelt iron ore into iron plates. The produced iron plates are needed as a resource for Lab crafting and subsequent research operations.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at position(–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of a single furnace entity used to smelt copper ore into copper plates. These copper plates are further processed into copper cables and electronic components required in the Lab crafting recipe.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Incorrect API usage for entity retrieval:
 – Avoid passing unexpected keyword arguments (e.g. using ‘radius’ when the function does not support it).
 – Do not supply extra positional arguments to functions like get_entities; verify the function signature before use.

• Placement and inventory validation errors:
 – Confirm that the required item (e.g. Lab) is present in the inventory before attempting placement.
 – Ensure that an entity is available for placement to prevent errors when the inventory lacks the necessary item.

• Handling NoneType returns:
 – When retrieving entities, check that the result is not None before iterating; use a fallback (such as an empty list) to avoid “NoneType object is not iterable” errors.

• Resource chain and sub-ingredient shortages:
 – Validate that all prerequisite resources and sub-components (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) are sufficiently available before starting complex crafting.
 – Plan resource production to cover cascading requirements and avoid repeated crafting failures.
